section.p: The Situational Awareness API returns a link from which you can view a video or image captured by an asset (camera).

There are two ways to retrieve media on demand
By AssetUid for Image or Video
By LocationUid for Image or Video

There are two ways to retrieve historical data:
By AssetUid for Image or Video
By LocationUid for Image or Video
Retrieve Most Recent Historical Data for Image or Video

section.title: Retrieve Media on Demand by AssetUid for Image or Video

section.p:
When retrieving media on demand:
Submit the HTTPS request. You will receive an imagePollURL or videoPollURL.
Submit the imagePollURL or videoPollURL.
The message “Success” returns if the media file you requested is in the database.
If the requested file is not in the database, it will retrieve the file from the node (on-demand).The timestamp in the request needs to match, up to the millisecond.
The message "InProgress" returns if the media file is not in the database. There is no timeout or error. For now, the recommendation is the application be set to a timeout of five minutes, but the developer has the flexibility to choose whatever timeout period they want.Media is retained by the node for seven days. If the requested media is older than seven days and is found in the cloud database, the PollURL returns the requested media.

row.entry: GE identifier for the media device

Filter by type of media.
Get Media only works when you have access to Situational Awareness.

Insert one of the following enumeration codes for a specific media type.IMAGEIf you filter by IMAGE, you receive a list of images in JPG, PNG, or GIF formats.Depending on the position of the camera, it will return the best resolution image available: either 320x240 for black and white or 1920x1080 for color.VIDEOIf you filter by VIDEO, you receive a list of videos in H.264 format.By default, the video length is 1 minute. You can use VLC player to open the video.AUDIOIf you filter by AUDIO, you receive a list of audio files in MP3 or WAV format. This is not supported in v2.OTHERSIf you filtered by OTHERS, you receive a list of non-standard formats.
Time of the event, recorded in EPOCH format.
The value to sort the content of the response by.

Insert one of the following codes for a response sorted by that value.mediaLogIdThe ID of each entry in the list.mediaUUIdThe ID of the specific type of node.mediaTypeEither video or image.mediaFileNameThe filename of the captured media.mediaTimestampThe time the media was captured from the node.assetUIdThe ID of the asset that captured the media.entryTimestampThe time the captured media was entered in the database.
Maximum number of records to return per page; if none specified, the default value of 2 is used automatically.
Indicates the page number; default is 0.
Indicates whether to sort in ascending or descending order

section.title: Retrieve Media on Demand by LocationUid for Image or Video

row.entry: A unique identifier established by a customer or external resource for a specific location within the monitored area

Filter by type of media.
Get Media only works when you have access to Situational Awareness.

Insert one of the following enumeration codes for a specific media type.IMAGEIf you filter by IMAGE, you receive a list of images in JPG, PNG, or GIF formats.Depending on the position of the camera, it will return the best resolution image available: either 320x240 for black and white or 1920x1080 for color.VIDEOIf you filter by VIDEO, you receive a list of videos in H.264 format.By default, the video length is 1 minute. You can use VLC player to open the video.AUDIOIf you filter by AUDIO, you receive a list of audio files in MP3 or WAV format. This is not supported in v2.OTHERSIf you filtered by OTHERS, you receive a list of non-standard formats.
Time of the event, recorded in EPOCH format.
The value to sort the content of the response by.

Insert one of the following codes for a response sorted by that value.mediaLogIdThe ID of each entry in the list.mediaUUIdThe ID of the specific type of node.mediaTypeEither video or image.mediaFileNameThe filename of the captured media.mediaTimestampThe time the media was captured from the node.assetUIdThe ID of the asset that captured the media.entryTimestampThe time the captured media was entered in the database.
Maximum number of records to return per page; if none specified, the default value of 2 is used automatically.
Indicates the page number; default is 0.
Indicates whether to sort in ascending or descending order

section.title: Retrieve Historical Data by AssetUid for Image or Video - Original
Sample Response for On-Demand Image or Video

row.entry: GE identifier for the media device.

Filter by type of media.
Get Media only works when you have access to Situational Awareness.

Insert one of the following enumeration codes for a specific media type.IMAGEIf you filter by IMAGE, you receive a list of images in JPG, PNG, or GIF formats.Depending on the position of the camera, it will return the best resolution image available: either 320x240 for black and white or 1920x1080 for color.VIDEOIf you filter by VIDEO, you receive a list of videos in H.264 format.By default, the video length is 1 minute. You can use VLC player to open the video.AUDIOIf you filter by AUDIO, you receive a list of audio files in MP3 or WAV format. This is not supported in v2.OTHERSIf you filtered by OTHERS, you receive a list of non-standard formats.
Time of the event, recorded in EPOCH format.
The value to sort the content of the response by.

Insert one of the following codes for a response sorted by that value.mediaLogIdThe ID of each entry in the list.mediaUUIdThe ID of the specific type of node.mediaTypeEither video or image.mediaFileNameThe filename of the captured media.mediaTimestampThe time the media was captured from the node.assetUIdThe ID of the asset that captured the media.entryTimestampThe time the captured media was entered in the database.

section.title: Retrieve Historical Data by LocationUid for Image or Video

row.entry: A unique identifier established by a customer or external resource for a specific location within the monitored area.

Filter by type of media.
Get Media only works when you have access to Situational Awareness.

Insert one of the following enumeration codes for a specific media type.IMAGEIf you filter by IMAGE, you receive a list of images in JPG, PNG, or GIF formats.Depending on the position of the camera, it will return the best resolution image available: either 320x240 for black and white or 1920x1080 for color.VIDEOIf you filter by VIDEO, you receive a list of videos in H.264 format.By default, the video length is 1 minute. You can use VLC player to open the video.AUDIOIf you filter by AUDIO, you receive a list of audio files in MP3 or WAV format. This is not supported in v2.OTHERSIf you filtered by OTHERS, you receive a list of non-standard formats.
Time of the event, recorded in EPOCH format.
The selected value to sort the response by.

Insert one of the following codes for a response sorted by that value.mediaLogIdThe ID of each entry in the list.mediaUUIdThe ID of the specific type of node.mediaTypeEither video or image.mediaFileNameThe filename of the captured media.mediaTimestampThe time the media was captured from the node.assetUIdThe ID of the asset that captured the media.entryTimestampThe time the captured media was entered in the database.
Indicates whether to sort in ascending or descending order

section.title: Retrieve Most Recent Historical Data for Image or Video

row.entry: GE identifier for the media device.

Filter by type of media.
Get Media only works when you have access to Situational Awareness.

Insert one of the following enumeration codes for a specific media type.IMAGEIf you filter by IMAGE, you receive a list of images in JPG, PNG, or GIF formats.Depending on the position of the camera, it will return the best resolution image available: either 320x240 for black and white or 1920x1080 for color.VIDEOIf you filter by VIDEO, you receive a list of videos in H.264 format.By default, the video length is 1 minute. You can use VLC player to open the video.AUDIOIf you filter by AUDIO, you receive a list of audio files in MP3 or WAV format. This is not supported in v2.OTHERSIf you filtered by OTHERS, you receive a list of non-standard formats.
The status of the response, either INPROGRESS or SUCCESS.

Each entry in the response will have these items shown in the sort order that was specified in the query.mediaLogIdThe ID of each entry in the list.mediaUUIdThe ID of the specific type of node.mediaTypeEither video or image.mediaFileNameThe filename of the captured media.mediaTimestampThe time the media was captured from the node.assetUidThe ID of the asset that captured the media.entryTimestampThe time the captured media was entered in the database.
Link to the stored media file in its captured format (for example, JPEG, PNG, MP4, MP3).

section.title: Sample Response for Retrieve Historical Media
